refnamediv.refpurpose: Menu: Defines diagram symbolic parameter values.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: When you select this menu item you obtain a dialog to enter any Scilab instructions for defining symbolic Scicos parameters used in block definitions or to do whatever you want.
These instructions will be evaluated each time the diagram is loaded.

The symbolic parameters defined in a main Diagram context or in a Super Block context can be used in all the lower hierachical levels. If a lower hierachical level redefines a symbolic parameter the new value applies only to the lower hierachical levels.
If you change the value of a symbolic Scicos parameters in the context, all the blocks are updated (Eval is automatically performed).

refsection.title: Remark
refsection.para: Even if it may work, it is not a good idea to use the Scilab variables to define symbolic parameters: particular values of symbolic parameters may change some diagram properties such as input output direct transfert and consequently imply a recompilation of the diagram (see Compile).

Moreover, defining the symbolic parameters in the context, insure that the Scicos diagram do not rely on external data. Once the diagram has been saved it contains all the informations to be run. The top level context data can also be used by scicos_simulate to define batch simulation context.
